item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Depending on weather and water conditions we may go up into Jordan cove , then pass by the Reactor Building:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

or just head out to Cher' (NO BULL) Island for a great view of the  Reactor Building from a SAFE  distance.

 

Remember what happened when we went NEAR the last power plant a few years ago ????

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vxchPg3Ty9s

Lets Hope no problems this year..

------------------------------------------------------------------------

From there its paddle to Harkness Memorial Park for a few hours of exploration and snack time. Check out the info: http://www.ct.gov/dep/lib/dep/stateparks/maps/harkness.pdf

PLEASE PULL UP YOUR KAYAKS A SHORT WAYS PAST THE SOUTH OF THE Harkness Park OBSERVATION PLATFORM (RIGHT SIDE OF IT). avoid some of the waders also...DO NOT LAND TO THE LEFT OF THE PLATFORM, Goshen Cove is a Restricted Preserve area because of some birds..etc...

A LARGER PIC OF THE CHART BELOW: **Please study the chart so you wont get lost** BY NOW MOST OF YOU SHOULD KNOW HOW TO NAVIGATE with charts and compasses anyway.

http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/3/2/8/d/highres_39312941.jpeg

.


 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

Rain, winds above 10K, or waves .GT. 1- 2 feet will most likely cancel the event.

Too soon to predict.

WEATHER:

WATER:  http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=41.30566601169448&lon=-72.18017578125&site=okx&unit=0&lg=en&FcstType=text

AIR:  http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KGON&state=CT

 

TIDE INFO: (study this and What does this mean to us along with the Chart above ???)

Tides for New London, State Pier starting with July 14, 2012.

Day        High      Tide  Height   Sunrise    Moon  Time      % Moon
           /Low      Time    Feet    Sunset                    Visible

Sa  14      Low   1:02 AM     0.6   5:28 AM    Rise  1:41 AM      24
    14     High   6:44 AM     2.2   8:21 PM     Set  4:42 PM
    14      Low  12:49 PM     0.8
    14     High   7:11 PM     3.0


mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

The After paddling event Potluck BBQ location is HURD PARK, Arrival time: UNKNOWN, its when we are  loaded up and get there.

Bring some wood and good food..

General directions from the paddle site----Head back to I-95 SOUTH, take rte 9 NORTH to Good Speed Oprah house and head North by the gelston house..Follow Brown Park signs.

OK---->>> Just use you GPS  (if ya dont have one ??? Good Luck = ya might get there or get lost)

apx GPS #50 Hurd Park Rd, East Hampton, CT to get you close enough

Follow signs to the BALL FIELD on right after entering the park..

See ya at the Nuclear Furnace and Tables under the roof..

vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv

OUR PRIMARY DESTINATION FOR THE PADDLE EVENT:

Boat Ramp Link:

We have to park carefully and  as space is limited to maybe 40 or so cars total here.

http://www.lisrc.uconn.edu/coastalaccess/site.asp?siteid=556

Fees None

Directions apx 54 minutes from Hartford (if no beach traffic).

APX GPS address:  # 16 DOCK ROAD, Waterford, CT.

The Meetup* Link at the top of the page is OK and use its information to get there for your specific directions.

Directions From Hartford should look like:

Get onto rte 2 EAST go apx 20 miles to rte 11 South

SINCE IT IS BEACH SEASON AND THE TRAFFIC IS USUALLY ACCUMULATING A MILE OR MORE BEFORE the end of THIS EXIT.

I AM GOING TO SUGGEST TAKING EXIT #5 off of rte 11 for Witch meadow Rd.

Take a left on Witch Meadow Rd and at end take a right onto RTE 85.

Go apx 10 miles and under the Rte I-395 underpass then take the first right onto CROSS Road

Take a LEFT onto rte 1 (Boston Whipping Post Road) go apx 1.6 miles)

Take a RIGHT onto AVERY LANE  (rte 213) which turns into GREAT NECK ROAD go apx 2 miles

Take a right onto GOSHEN RD and go to end (Shore rd-Dock Road). Unload & Park on left in the parking lot

 

-------------------------

KAYAKS AVAILABLE:

The following Kayaks with paddles and life jackets are available for the put in site if reserved in advance:

Note: if you reserve a kayak and i take it all the way to the site and you do not show -- you will never join us again for any event, these are my personal hobby boats and its asked you be sincere in showing up besides i ask less than half of what a local shop charges and you get better equipment right at the event site.

Yes i will understand  traffic may cause you to be late and if i hear of of any traffic via my GPS or by other arriving members, then we usually wait a bit longer than normal.

Please get a GPS, or a GPS with traffic data is even better.

 

 

Boat use Doughnation is $20.00.

 

KAYAK #1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide.

This is an expedition style sea kayak designed for rough sea conditions and heavy loads.

Highly stable (initial & secondary), heavy weight (52 LB).       
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer

RESERVED FOR KYLE

 

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 160 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.    http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=706

FOR SALE

 

 

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak,  Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (95 - 140 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=702

RESERVED FOR KYLE'S GUEST

 


KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version

(Very Thin Fibreglass), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.       
Small to Medium sized paddler (90 - 135 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cockpit so make sure you can fit in it.

http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

RESERVED  FOR AL-R



KAYAK #5:    Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, Fixed Skeg 18' @ 20" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea Kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull, heavy weight (50 lbs).

Greenland style Paddle available also if specifically REQUESTED.

http://www.cricketdesigns.com/greenland.htm .

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 125 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

RESERVED FOR KAREN

 

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro,  Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style, kayak for ocean crusing. 18' @ 21" wide,  heavy weight 50 lb

Greenland style sea kayak. Medium sized paddler (150-180 lbs) with  a MINIMUM of Intermediate to Advanced sea paddling skills needed for this boat.

http://www.maineislandkayak.com/ndk_greenlander.html#greenlanderpro

AVAILABLE
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me wearing my ORANGE NUCLEAR GLOW HAT at the boat ramp area.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT

item.name: JUL 14 KAYAK to Cher' (No Bull) Islnd + Destination stop @ Harkness Memorial Pk
